intro: Fadogia verdickii, commonly known as the African velvet tamarind, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds. Fadogia verdickii is often found in woodland and savanna habitats, and it plays a role in soil enrichment due to its nitrogen-fixing ability.
